    • Method Detail

      • getIntValue

        public java.lang.Integer getIntValue(int formatType)
        Return an Integer value of the specified type. This operation will automatically advance the internal offset to the next position.
        Parameters:
        formatType - the format type used to interpret the byte(s) value
        Returns:
        an Integer object or null in case the byte array was not valid

      • getIntValue

        public java.lang.Integer getIntValue(int formatType,
                                     int offset)
        Return the stored value of this byte array.

        The formatType parameter determines how the byte array is to be interpreted. For example, settting formatType to FORMAT_UINT16 specifies that the first two bytes of the byte array at the given offset are interpreted to generate the return value.

        Parameters:
        formatType - The format type used to interpret the byte array.
        offset - Offset at which the integer value can be found.
        Returns:
        Cached value of the byte array or null of offset exceeds value size.

      • getFloatValue

        public java.lang.Float getFloatValue(int formatType)
        Return a float value of the specified format. This operation will automatically advance the internal offset to the next position.
        Parameters:
        formatType -
        Returns:

      • getFloatValue

        public java.lang.Float getFloatValue(int formatType,
                                     int offset)
        Return the stored value in this byte array
        Parameters:
        formatType - The format type used to interpret the byte array
        offset - Offset at which the float value can be found.
        Returns:
        Cached value at a given offset or null if the requested offset exceeds the value size.
